meanings.definition: To cause extreme fear or terror in someone.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder torrifies my little sister during storms.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie torrifies me every time I watch it.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house torrifies visitors with its spooky decorations.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned building torrifies even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of the ghost torrifies the unsuspecting travelers.

meanings.definition: To fill someone with great fear or dread.
meanings.sent1: The thought of failing the test torrifies the students.
meanings.sent2: The news of the approaching storm torrifies the residents of the town.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having to speak in public torrifies him more than anything else.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure lurking in the alley torrifies the late-night walkers.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the monster torrifies the children in the small village.
